posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Dropping this here for any that finds this post:

A run through all the applicable modules and semi-applicable modules out there that will enhance the undestanding of the lore and how they all ... intertwine.  Now, do I replay/play them all prior? THAT is the question of the hour.

Luke Scull - The Blades of Netheril - A Guide to What to Play Beforehand
https://www.patreon.com/posts/blades-of-guide-68776086

Actually I'll provide a brief summary of the various character paths for anyone interested, each one is a separate character play through with overlapping and optional semi-overlapping lore (read the link above for more detail):
  1. Wailing Death (Original Game) -> The Blades of Netheril Campaign of which Doom of Icewind Dale ("New DLC") is the second "chapter" of seven.
  2. Shadows of Undrentide -> Hordes of the Underdark (Original Expansions)
  3. Tyrants of the Moonsea (Premium Module)
  • Optionally, Tyrants of the Moonsea is a pseudo sequel to the following stand alone modules with one overlap in level range and with limited overlapping lore: 
    Siege of Shadowdale -> Crimson Tides of Tethyr -> Tyrants of the Moonsea
    • AlternativelySiege of Shadowdale -> Darkness over Daggerford -> Tyrants of the Moonsea
Siege of Shadowdale is a Community Curated Content - Enhanced Edition module
Crimson Tides of Tethyr is a Community Curated Content - Enhanced Edition module
Darkness over Daggerford is a Premium Module

That is the summary as best as I can lay it out :)
